--- title: Managing and securing enterprise content at scale 300-level live demo description: Managing and securing enterprise content at scale 300-level live demo tabs: [ 'Demo preparation', 'Demo script'] --- export const Title = () => (

Managing and securing enterprise content at scale
300-level live demo

 ); ![Managing and securing banner](./images/Managing-and-Securing-300-Script-GitHub-banner-12-15-21.jpg) | DEMO OVERVIEW | | | :--- | :--- | | **Scenario overview** | This demo shows how Enterprise Content Management (FileNet ECM – IBM Content Navigator) capabilities in the IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation facilitate collaboratively using documents. To illustrate this, a company’s hiring team collaborates during a hiring process. | | **Demo products** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation | | **Demo capabilities** | Document Management | | **Sales guidance** | Download the sales guidance document here. | | **Demo intro slides** | Download the Introduction and Overview slides here. This is a short deck of customer-facing slides that sets the context for the demo. | | **Demo script** | A complete demo script is on the second tab above. You can download a printer-ready PDF of the demo script here.

This demo script has multiple tasks, that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and what diagrams and screenshots you will see.

This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based on your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. If it seems difficult for you to execute, the customer will focus on your delivery. | | **Customer-ready
demo video** | View the demo video here. This is a short, but detailed, hands-on walkthrough of the scenario. The video is customer-ready.

Potential uses of this video are:

1. Familiarize yourself with the details of this scenario
2. Gain customer agreement that they would like to have a tech-seller do a deep-dive demo of this scenario
3. Use as a prospecting tool to generate customer interest in these capabilities | | **Customer-facing
expert guidance** | TBD | | **Demo architecture** |
| | **Required versions** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation V22.0.1. | | **How to get support** | **For IBMers:**
• Contact #itz-techzone-support or techzone.help@ibm.com regarding issues with reserving and provisioning Tech Zone environments.
• Contact #platinumdemos-automation-support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo.

**For Business Partners:**
• Contact Tech Zone Support regarding issues with reserving and provisioning Tech Zone environments.
• Contact Automation Platinum Demos Support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo. | ## **INSTALL THE DEMO** (normal headline) ## **DEMO INSTALLATION AND SETUP**
1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment
Install Cloud Pak for Business Automation **22.0.1** or provision a pre-installed ROKS environment. To reserve your pre-installed ROKS instance, follow these steps:
1. To reserve a preinstalled Cloud Pak for Business Automation (CP4BA) V22.0.1 on Red Hat OpenShift, go here and complete the form. (If you do not have a sales opportunity, select the purpose **Practice / Self-Education** to create a 3-day reservation (which can be extended to 8 days).
2. You will receive a confirmation email confirming the instance is provisioning.
3. You will receive a second email once the environment is provisioned. This email contains information, such as URLs, allowing you to connect to the instance.
If you have issues connecting to your instance, please contact TechZone support or refer to the installation documentation here.

4. The full installation of the Cloud Pak for Business Automation will take an additional 6-8 hours. After the waiting period is over, click the **Cluster URL** contained in the second email you received.

5. Ensure you are on an **ITZ account**.


6. Ensure there are no **Alerts** for the cluster.

7. Click the **OpenShift web console** blue button on the top right corner of the screen.


8. Expand **Workloads** (1) and click **Config Maps** (2).


9. Select the **cp4ba** project.


10. Search for **access** in the search area.

It can take up to 8 hours for the ConfigMap 'icp4adeploy-cp4ba-accesss-info' to be ready (after you receive the email containing the environment access instructions). If the ConfigMap does not appear in 8 hours, refer to the ROKS help site or contact Tech Zone Support.
11. Click the **icp4adeploy-cp4ba-access-info** file.


12. Scroll down and look for **ADS-designer-access-info** in the **Data** section


When the ADS designer access info is present in the data file, it indicates the CP4BA setup is completed. You are ready to proceed with the other setup instructions.
Please contact TechZone support if you don’t see the access file info after 8 hours.
**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Bookmark URLs
In this section you will create a cheat sheet collecting all the links to CP4BA applications you will need for the demo.
1. Click **Workloads** to expand the menu.


2. Select **ConfigMaps**.


3. Type **'access'** in the search field (the results are automatically filtered)


4. Click **icpdeploy-cp4ba-access-info**.


5. Scroll to **cpe-access-info** in the data section.


6. Bookmark the **Content Platform Engine administration** (ACCE) URL. Copy the **username** and **password** to your cheat sheet.


This URL opens ACCE during the demo and demo prep.
7. Scroll to **navigator-access-info**. Bookmark the **Business Automation Navigator for CP4BA** URL. Copy the **username** and **password** to your cheat sheet.


This URL opens Business Automation Navigator during the demo and demo prep.

8. Scroll to **bastudio-access-info**. Bookmark the **Cloudpak Dashboard** URL.


This URL opens Business Automation Studio during the demo and demo prep.

9. Copy the Cloud Pak for Business Automation **User credentials** from the bottom of the same section to your cheat sheet.

“cp4admin” is the username for all CP4BA platform components in the demo.


**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Create users
The demo has 3 personas:
1. **Henry**, the HR Manager
2. **Debby**, the hiring Manager
3. **Patrick**, the payroll Manager

Let’s configure the individual accounts for Henry, Debby, and Patrick in the CP4BA Instance. First, we must create logins in the platform LDAP:
1. Select **Secrets**.


2. Type '**openldap'** (1) in the search field. In the results, click the **cp4adeploy-openldap-customldif** file (2).


3. Click **Actions** (1) and then select **Edit Secret** (2).


4. Let’s update the **ldapfile_user.ldif file**. In order to see all the information at once, update the file in a separate text editor (e.g., Word).

Copy the existing text by clicking in the editing panel, pressing [CTRL]+[A] to select all the text, and pressing [CTRL]+[C] to copy the text.


5. Paste the text in a text editor.
6. Copy the data for Henry, Debby, and Patrick below and paste (2) into your text editor after the user named rrServiceUser (1).


dn: uid=henry,dc=example,dc=org
uid: henry
cn: henry
sn: henry
userpassword: henry2022
objectClass: top
objectClass: posixAccount
objectClass: organizationalPerson
objectClass: inetOrgPerson
objectClass: person
uidNumber: #####+1
gidNumber: XXXXXX
homeDirectory: /home/henry/
mail: henry@example.org

dn: uid=debby,dc=example,dc=org
uid: debby
cn: debby
sn: debby
userpassword: debby2022
objectClass: top
objectClass: posixAccount
objectClass: organizationalPerson
objectClass: inetOrgPerson
objectClass: person
uidNumber: #####+2
gidNumber: XXXXXX
homeDirectory: /home/debby/
mail: rrServiceUser@example.org

dn: uid=patrick,dc=example,dc=org
uid: patrick
cn: patrick
sn: patrick
userpassword: patrick2022
objectClass: top
objectClass: posixAccount
objectClass: organizationalPerson
objectClass: inetOrgPerson
objectClass: person
uidNumber: #####+3
gidNumber: XXXXXX
homeDirectory: /home/patrick/
mail: patrick@example.org

7. Copy the **gidNumber** from the **rrServiceUser**.


8. Replace **XXXXXX** in the **gidNumber field** for the new user Henry. Repeat for Debby and then Patrick.


9. Assign a new **uidNmber** for Henry, Debby, and Patrick by noting the **uidNumber** for **rrServiceUser** and adding 1 sequentially.

For example, if rrServiceUser uidNumber: 14583116, then Henry’s uidNumber is 14583117, Henry’s uidNumber is 14583118, Henry’s uidNumber is 14583119.

The final new users should look like the below:


10. Cut and past the following text at the end of the **GeneralUsers** list:

member: uid=henry,dc=example,dc=org
member: uid=debby,dc=example,dc=org
member: uid=patrick,dc=example,dc=org


11. Cut and past the following text at the end of the **TaskUsers** list at the end of the file:

member: uid=henry,dc=example,dc=org
member: uid=debby,dc=example,dc=org
member: uid=patrick,dc=example,dc=org


12. Select and copy all the text from your editor and replace the text in the **Value** (1) text box. Click **Save** (2).


13. Click on **Reveal values**.


14. Check that your updates are present.


15. Now restart the LDAP pod so the updates are implemented. Start by clicking **Pods**.


16. Type '**openldap**' in the search field.


17. When the results display, click the **menu** icon (1) on the row containing **icp4adeploy-openldap-deploy-XXXXX-XXX** (the numbers at the end will vary.). Select **Delete Pod** (2).


18. Click **Delete**.


19. A new pod will automatically be re-created for you.


We are ready to log in as “henry”, “debby” and “patrick” using the passwords you have just created.

Let’s now add and assign roles to these 3 new users in Cloud Pack for Business Automation. First, we need to recover the platform Admin password.

20. Click **Secrets**.


21. Click the down arrow next to **Project: cp4ba** (1). Select **ibm-common-services** (2).


22. Type '**auth-idp**' in the search field (1) and click **platform-auth-idp-credentials** (2).


23. Click **Reveal values**.


24. Cut and paste the admin password from your cheat sheet.
This is the username and password you copied from the bastudio-access-info section of the icpdeploy-cp4ba-access-info ConfigMap earlier in this demo prep.
Let’s now add the 3 users to the CP4A user administration panel.

25. Open Business Automation Studio and sign in using the URL, **Username**: admin (1) and, and **password** (2) you copied to your cheat sheet in a prior step. Click **Log in** (3).
Make sure not to use the cp4admin username.
26. Click the **menu** icon in the top right corner of the page.


27. Select **IBM Automation (cp4ba)**.


28. Click **Manage users**.


29. Click **Add users**.


30. Type '**henry**' in the search area (1), then click on **henry** in the result list (2).


31. Add '**debby**' and '**patrick**' by repeating the prior step replacing henry with their names.

32. Check that **henry**, **debby** and **patrick** are added (1). Click **Next** (2).


33. Select **Assign roles directly** (1) and click **Next** (2).


34. Check **Automation Administrator** and **Automation Developer** (1) and then click **Next** (2).


35. Click **Add**.


36. Check that the three users are added.


37. Log out from Business Automation Studio.

Let’s now add Henry as an Administrator in Navigator so that he can show the role-based redactions during the demo.

38. Access IBM Content Navigator using the URL you bookmarked from the **icpdeploy-cp4ba-access-info** ConfigMap. Log in as **cp4admin /Password** (1) and click **Log in** (2).


39. Click the **hamburger** menu at the top left of the page.


Click **Administration**.


40. Click **Settings**.


41. Click the **Administrators** tab.


42. Type '**henry**' (1) in the **New Administrator** field and click **Add** (2).


43. Click **Save and Close**.


44. Hover your mouse over the **user** icon (1) and click **Log Out** (2).


45. Sign in using the **Username**: henry and **Password**: henry2022 (1). Click **Log in** (2).


46. Click the **hamburger** icon at the top left of the page.


47. Make sure **Administration** menu displays as an option for Henry to select.



**[Go to top](#top)**
